intro: Ageratum connatifolium, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in compact clusters, often forming a spherical shape. Ageratum connatifolium is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its colorful blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
